text.0: in the great synod will i laud thy two bay steeds i prize the sweet strong drink of thee the warriorgod.
text.1: his who pours lovely oil as twere with yellow drops let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.
text.2: ye who in concert sing unto the goldhued place like bay steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat.
text.3: for indra laud ye strength allied with tawny steeds laud him whom cows content as twere with yellow drops.
text.4: his is that thunderbolt of iron goldenhued goldcoloured very dear and yellow in his arms.
text.5: bright with strong teeth destroying with its tawny rage in indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.
text.6: as if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky the golden thunderbolt spread out as in a race.
text.7: that iron bolt with yellow jaw smote ahi down a thousand flames had he who bore the tawnyhued.
text.8: thou thou when praised by men who sacrificed of old hadst pleasure in their lauds o indra goldenhaired.
text.9: all that befits thy song of praise thou welcornest the perfect pleasant gift o goldenhued from birth.
text.10: these two dear bays bring hither indra on his car thunderarmed joyous meet for laud to drink his fill.
text.11: many libations flow for him who loveth them to indra have the goldhued soma juices run.
text.12: tle goldhued drops have flowed to gratify his wish the yellow dro s have urged the swift bays to the strong.
text.13: he who speeds on with bay steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.
text.14: at the swift draught the somadrinker waxed in might the iron one with yellow beard and yellow hair.
text.15: he lord of tawny coursers lord of fleetfoot mares will bear his bay steeds safely over all distress.
text.16: his yellowcoloured jaws like ladles move apart what time for strength he makes the yellowtinted stir.
text.17: when while the bowl stands there he grooms his tawny steeds when he hath drunk strong drink the sweet juice that he loves.
text.18: yea to the dear ones seat in homes of heaven and earth the bay steeds lord hath whinnied like a horse for food.
text.19: then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily and the beloved one hath gained high power of life.
text.20: thou comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new.
text.21: o asura disclose thou and make visible the cows beloved home to the bright golden sun.
text.22: o indra let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee delightful goldenvisored on thy car.
text.23: that pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil thou mayest at the feast drink of our offered meath.
text.24: juices aforetime lord of bays thou drankest and thine especially is this libation.
text.25: gladden thee indra with the meathrich soma pour it down ever mighty one within thee.
